001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import static io.github.ai4ci.abm.HistoryMapper.MAPPER;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.Optional;
009import java.util.function.Predicate;
010
011import org.slf4j.Logger;
012import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

014import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Contact;
015import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Exposure;
016import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableContact;
017import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableExposure;
018import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakHistory;
019import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
020import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonHistory;
021import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
022import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelUpdate;
023import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak;
024import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiablePerson;
025import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
026import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
027import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonState;
028import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater;
029import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater;
030import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.TriConsumer;
031import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
032import io.github.ai4ci.util.Ephemeral;
033import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
034
035/**
036 * The updater is the main handler of the update cycle. It contains the hard
037 * coded bits of the update cycle and configurable aspects can be added with
038 * person processors and outbreak processors which can be created with
039 * {@link #withPersonProcessor(Predicate, TriConsumer)} or
040 * {@link #withOutbreakProcessor(Predicate, TriConsumer)} and pre-canned update
041 * configurations are found in the {@link ModelUpdate} class.
042 *
043 * <br>
044 * <br>
045 * Within the update process at each time step the contact network is determined
046 * by the {@link #contactNetwork(Outbreak)} method. This is the key determinant
047 * of exposures, from social network connections and, if supported, venue driven
048 * connections.
049 *
050 * <br>
051 * <br>
052 * The updater follows the following process:
053 * <ul>
054 * <li><u>prepareUpdate:</u> Creates a Ephemeral OutbreakState and PersonState
055 * builder in Outbreak and each Person respectively, from the current state.
056 * This will be used to process state changes and will become the current state
057 * at the next time point. Similarly creates a OutbreakHistory and PersonHistory
058 * builder from the current states, using
059 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.HistoryMapper HistoryMapper}. These will become
060 * the historical record of the current state at the original time point. At
061 * this point the head of the history list still points to the previous day
062 * (t-1) and the current state to (t).</li>
063 * <li><u>updateHistory:</u> This stage is responsible for filling in events
064 * that can be regarded as happening at the end of the day (t). Firstly the
065 * contacts made during the day are simulated and recorded, depending on the
066 * state of the agents. Secondly updates are made to the model as defined by
067 * policy and behaviours. This mostly includes updating agents with records of
068 * the testing performed during the current day (t). This is done by the end of
069 * day function in the the behaviour state (see
070 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.BehaviourState}) which implements
071 * an <em>updateHistory</em> hook for person histories, and in the policy state
072 * (see {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.PolicyState}) which
073 * implements an <em>updateHistory</em> hook for outbreak histories. At the end
074 * of this stage the head of the history list points to the original previous
075 * day (t-1) and the current state is still at the original day (t).
076 *
077 * <br>
078 * The updateHistory phase first operates on the Outbreak and then on each
079 * Person in the simulation.</li>
080 * <li><u>switchHistory:</u> At this point the head of the OutbreakHistory list
081 * and PersonHistory lists are updated to point to the copy created from the
082 * current state in the last step. After this point the head of the history list
083 * points to the same day (t) as the current state (t).</li>
084 * <li><u>updateState:</u> The second phase of the updates is focussed on
085 * changes that happen at the start of the next day (t+1). For all agents their
086 * in host viral load model is updated with information about any exposures that
087 * happened in the previous day (t) and the model advanced one time step top
088 * (t+1). Similarly based on observed contacts, and their observed risks and
089 * test results the per agent risk model is updated to represent what each agent
090 * could know about their risk at time (t+1) based on information up to and
091 * including time (t). Behavioural changes are then applied using the behaviour
092 * state's {@code nextState} hook
093 * ({@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.BehaviourState}), and in the
094 * policy state via its {@code nextState} hook
095 * ({@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.PolicyState}). State
096 * implementations use the context and RNG to decide the next state and may
097 * mutate the supplied builders where necessary.
098 *
099 * <br>
100 * <br>
101 * When using this care must be taken to recognise that the first day in history
102 * is the current day that is being updated (t). After this the current state is
103 * still at time (t) and the head of the history list at time (t) - however the
104 * agents in host viral load and risk models are already updated to (t+1).
105 *
106 * <br>
107 * The updateState phase first operates on the Outbreak and then on each Person
108 * in the simulation.</li>
109 * <li><u>switchState:</u> At this point the current states of the outbreak (t)
110 * or agents is switched to point to the newly created future state representing
111 * the next day in the simulation (t+1). When this happens the simulation day
112 * counter is effectively incremented. After this point the head of an agents
113 * history list points to the previous day (t) and the current state is
114 * referring to (t+1) (including in host and risk models)</li>
115 * </ul>
116 *
117 * <img src="updater.png" alt="Updater process flow diagram">
118 */
119public class Updater {
120
121        static Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(Updater.class);
122
123        /**
124         * Generate an exposure from a contact event between an potential infector
125         * and an infectee.
126         *
127         * This is where the probability of transmission is applied to determine
128         * whether a contact results in an exposure. If it does, the amount of
129         * exposure is determined by the infector's viral load. The infector is only
130         * considered if they are currently infectious, as determined by their
131         * in-host model. If the infector is not infectious, no exposure occurs
132         * regardless of the contact. If the infector is infectious, the probability
133         * of transmission is calculated by combining the infector's transmissibility
134         * and the infectee's susceptibility modifier, which are combined using an
135         * odds ratio scaling function. The resulting exposure is represented as an
136         * {@link Exposure} object, which includes the ID of the infector and the
137         * amount of exposure. If the contact does not result in an exposure, an
138         * empty Optional is returned. This method is a key part of the transmission
139         * process in the model, linking social interactions (contacts) to potential
140         * infection events (exposures).
141         *
142         * @param contact  the contact event
143         * @param infectee the person who may be infected
144         * @param infector the person who may be infectious
145         * @return an Optional containing the Exposure if transmission occurs, or
146         *         empty if not
147         */
148        public static Optional<Exposure> asExposure(
149                        Contact contact, PersonState infectee, PersonState infector
150        ) {
151
152                var sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
153
154                if (!infector.isInfectious()) { return Optional.empty(); }
155
156                // This is where transmission rate / susceptability plays a role.
157                var trans = Conversions.scaleProbabilityByOR(
158                                infector.getAdjustedTransmissibility(),
159                                infectee.getSusceptibilityModifier()
160                );
161
162                var transmitted = sampler.bern(trans);
163                if (!transmitted) { return Optional.empty(); }
164
165                return Optional.of(
166                                ImmutableExposure.builder()
167                                                .setExposerId(infector.getEntity().getId())
168                                                // Should the amount of exposure be dependent on the
169                                                // probability of transmission or is this a stochastic
170                                                // event? My belief is the latter. If it happens, the
171                                                // dose of virus is independent of how likely it was
172                                                // to happen. Probability of transmission depends on
173                                                // whether contact coughs, dose depends on how much
174                                                // virus they cough over you.
175                                                // See PersonState#getContactExposure for where this is
176                                                // picked up and fed into the in host model.
177                                                .setExposure(infector.getNormalisedViralLoad())
178                                                // .setTransmissionProbability(trans)
179                                                .build()
180                );
181        }
182
183        /**
184         * Build the contact network for a specific outbreak day.
185         *
186         * @param outbreak the simulation
187         * @return a PersonStateContacts data structure with contacts and exposures
188         *         for every individual in the model (potentially empty).
189         */
190        public static PersonStateContacts contactNetwork(Outbreak outbreak) {
191                // Do the contact network here? and pass it as a parameter to the
192                // person updateState
193                var network = outbreak.getSocialNetwork();
194                var out = new PersonStateContacts(
195                                outbreak.getPeople().size(),
196                                network.size() / outbreak.getPeople().size() * 4
197                );
198
199                network.parallelStream().forEach(r -> {
200                        var sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
201                        var one = r.getSource(outbreak).getCurrentState();
202                        var two = r.getTarget(outbreak).getCurrentState();
203
204                        // TODO: contacts stratified by venue such as work or school
205                        // connectedness quantile is a proxy for the context of a contact
206                        // If we wanted to control this a different set of features of the
207                        // relationship could be used. At the moment this overloads mobility
208                        // with type of contact, but in reality WORK contacts may be less
209                        // Significant that home contacts. This is where we would implement
210                        // something along these lines.
211
212                        var contactProbability = r.contactProbability(
213                                        one.getAdjustedMobility(), two.getAdjustedMobility()
214                        );
215
216                        if (sampler.bern(contactProbability)) {
217                                // This is a contact.
218                                // Contact transmission probability depends on lowest
219                                // transmissibility
220
221                                var oneref = one.getEntity().getId();
222                                var tworef = two.getEntity().getId();
223
224                                var jointDetect = one.getAdjustedAppUseProbability()
225                                                * two.getAdjustedAppUseProbability()
226                                                * outbreak.getCurrentState().getContactDetectedProbability();
227
228                                var detected = sampler.bern(jointDetect);
229
230                                Contact contact = ImmutableContact.builder().setDetected(detected)
231                                                .setParticipant1Id(oneref).setParticipant2Id(tworef)
232                                                // TODO: Proximity and duration of a contact aren't handled
233                                                // .setProximityDuration(contactProbability)
234                                                .build();
235
236                                out.write(oneref).put(tworef, contact);
237                                out.write(tworef).put(oneref, contact);
238
239                                asExposure(contact, one, two)
240                                                .ifPresent(e -> out.writeExp(oneref).put(tworef, e));
241                                asExposure(contact, two, one)
242                                                .ifPresent(e -> out.writeExp(tworef).put(oneref, e));
243                        }
244                });
245
246                return out;
247
248        }
249
250        private List<PersonStateUpdater> personProcessors = new ArrayList<>();
251
252        private List<OutbreakStateUpdater> outbreakProcessors = new ArrayList<>();
253
254        public Updater() {
255                this.outbreakProcessors = new ArrayList<>();
256                for (ModelUpdate.OutbreakUpdaterFn value : ModelUpdate.OutbreakUpdaterFn
257                                .values()) {
258                        this.outbreakProcessors.add(value.fn());
259                }
260                this.personProcessors = new ArrayList<>();
261                for (ModelUpdate.PersonUpdaterFn value : ModelUpdate.PersonUpdaterFn
262                                .values()) {
263                        this.personProcessors.add(value.fn());
264                }
265
266        }
267
268        /**
269         * set the nextState builders for outbreak and each of the people, copying
270         * the current state and incrementing the time. At the same time we populate
271         * the nextHistory for outbreak and people from the current state (and
272         * current time)
273         */
274        private void prepareUpdate(Outbreak outbreak) {
275
276                if (outbreak instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
277                        var m = (ModifiableOutbreak) outbreak;
278
279                        m.setNextState(
280                                        Ephemeral.of(
281                                                        ImmutableOutbreakState.builder().from(m.getCurrentState())
282                                                                        .setTime(m.getCurrentState().getTime() + 1)
283                                        )
284                        );
285
286                        m.setNextHistory(
287                                        Ephemeral.of(
288                                                        ImmutableOutbreakHistory.builder()
289                                                                        .from(MAPPER.createHistory(m.getCurrentState()))
290                                        )
291                        );
292
293                        m.getStateMachine().prepareUpdate();
294                }
295
296                outbreak.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(person -> {
297                        if (person instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
298                                var p = (ModifiablePerson) person;
299
300                                p.setNextState(
301                                                Ephemeral.of(
302                                                                ImmutablePersonState.builder().from(p.getCurrentState())
303                                                                                .setTime(p.getCurrentState().getTime() + 1)
304                                                                                .setImmunisationDose(0D)
305                                                                                .setImportationExposure(0D)
306                                                )
307                                );
308
309                                p.setNextHistory(
310                                                Ephemeral.of(
311                                                                ImmutablePersonHistory.builder()
312                                                                                .from(MAPPER.createHistory(p.getCurrentState()))
313                                                )
314                                );
315
316                                p.getStateMachine().prepareUpdate();
317                        }
318                });
319
320        }
321
322        /**
323         * Switches in a new state for a model by building the next state and setting
324         * the current state to the new state. Makes sure that the agents state are
325         * all also updated before updating the model state, and record the new state
326         * in the model history. This means the model history is always up to date
327         * with the current model state.
328         *
329         * <br>
330         * N.B. This is where the limit in person history length is implemented.
331         */
332        private void switchHistory(Outbreak outbreak) {
333                var limit = Math.max(
334                                outbreak.getBaseline().getSymptomDuration(),
335                                outbreak.getBaseline().getInfectiveDuration()
336                ) * 2;
337                if (outbreak instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
338                        var m = (ModifiableOutbreak) outbreak;
339                        m.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(person -> {
340                                if (person instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
341                                        var p = (ModifiablePerson) person;
342                                        synchronized (p) {
343                                                var tmp = p.getHistory();
344                                                tmp.add(0, p.getNextHistory().toOptional().get().build());
345                                                while (tmp.size() > limit) {
346                                                        tmp.remove(limit);
347                                                }
348                                                p.setNextHistory(p.getNextHistory().clear());
349                                        }
350                                }
351                        });
352                        synchronized (m) {
353                                m.getHistory()
354                                                .add(0, m.getNextHistory().toOptional().get().build());
355                                m.setNextHistory(m.getNextHistory().clear());
356                        }
357                }
358        }
359
360        /**
361         * Switches in a new state for a model by building the next state and setting
362         * the current state to the new state. Makes sure that the agents state are
363         * all also updated before updating the model state, and record the new state
364         * in the model history. This means the model history is always up to date
365         * with the current model state
366         *
367         * @param outbreak the mutable model.
368         */
369        private void switchState(Outbreak outbreak) {
370                if (outbreak instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
371                        var m = (ModifiableOutbreak) outbreak;
372                        m.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(person -> {
373                                if (person instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
374                                        var p = (ModifiablePerson) person;
375                                        synchronized (p) {
376                                                // TODO: Update spatio-temporal state network if explicit.
377                                                // This is where the new and old state co-exist
378                                                // it is one place where we could make a record in a
379                                                // spatio-temporal network. Possibly the only place.
380                                                // It would have to be thread safe and non blocking.
381                                                // alternatively we can just use the PersonHistory for this
382                                                p.setCurrentState(
383                                                                p.getNextState().toOptional().get().build()
384                                                );
385                                                p.setNextState(p.getNextState().clear());
386                                        }
387                                }
388                        });
389                        synchronized (m) {
390                                m.setCurrentState(m.getNextState().toOptional().get().build());
391                                m.setNextState(m.getNextState().clear());
392
393                        }
394                }
395        }
396
397        /**
398         * The main update method is called to advance the simulation by one day.
399         *
400         * @param outbreak a simulation to update
401         * @return the same outbreak with new states and histories
402         */
403        public Outbreak update(Outbreak outbreak) {
404                this.prepareUpdate(outbreak);
405                // at this point the "current history" is the same as the previous state
406                this.updateHistory(outbreak);
407                this.switchHistory(outbreak);
408                // at this point the "current history" is the same as the current state
409                this.updateState(outbreak);
410                this.switchState(outbreak);
411                // at this point the "current history" is the same as the previous state
412                log.debug(
413                                "Update: " + outbreak.getUrn() + "; Step:"
414                                                + outbreak.getCurrentState().getTime()
415                );
416                return outbreak;
417        }
418
419        /**
420         * The contact network is established for every person. then update the
421         * outbreak history according to the current policy. Then the person
422         * histories according to their current behaviour. This second step is where
423         * the behaviour models implement testing.
424         */
425        private void updateHistory(Outbreak outbreak) {
426                // Sampler sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
427                if (outbreak instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
428                        // This is always true BTW.
429                        var m = (ModifiableOutbreak) outbreak;
430                        var contactNetwork = contactNetwork(m);
431//                      Contact[][] contacts = contactNetwork.finaliseContacts();
432//                      Exposure[][] exposures = contactNetwork.finaliseExposures();
433
434                        // Update the next history entry with anything from the current
435                        var sampler1 = Sampler.getSampler();
436                        var nextOutbreakHistory = outbreak.getNextHistory().toOptional().get();
437                        m.getStateMachine().performHistoryUpdate(
438                                        nextOutbreakHistory, outbreak.getCurrentState(), sampler1
439                        );
440
441                        m.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(person -> {
442
443                                var sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
444                                var nextPersonHistory = person.getNextHistory().toOptional().get();
445
446                                if (person instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
447                                        var p = (ModifiablePerson) person;
448
449                                        var ref = p.getId();
450                                        nextPersonHistory
451                                                        .setTodaysContacts(contactNetwork.getContactsForId(ref))
452                                                        .setTodaysExposures(contactNetwork.getExposuresForId(ref));
453
454                                        p.getStateMachine().performHistoryUpdate(
455                                                        nextPersonHistory, person.getCurrentState(), sampler
456                                        );
457
458                                }
459
460                        });
461                }
462        }
463
464        /**
465         * Creates the next model state factory, as a copy of current state and
466         * applies a chain of OutbreakUpdaters to pre-process the next state factory.
467         * Then applies the updates to each of the agents, then applies a chain of
468         * OutbreakUpdaters to post-process the next state factory. The pre and post
469         * processors can change the next state by modifying the state factory
470         *
471         * @param person the mutable holder for the immutable person state.
472         */
473        private void updateState(Outbreak outbreak) {
474
475                // This is a bit complex to order changes so that things are built in
476                // correct order.
477                // 1) make a new OutbreakState.Builder
478                // 2) copy current state into new history and make a set of
479                // PersonHistory.Builder
480                // 3) update PersonHistory.Builders with test results based on current
481                // state
482                // 4) update PersonHistory.Builders with contacts based on current state
483                // 5) switch the PersonHistory List with current step history from Builder
484                // 6) make a set of next state PersonState.Builders based on current state
485                // 7) update PersonState.Builders behaviour based on current step history
486                // 8)
487
488                var sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
489                var nextState = outbreak.getNextState().toOptional().get();
490                if (outbreak instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
491                        var m = (ModifiableOutbreak) outbreak;
492                        // Update the state machine (for the outbreak).
493                        m.getStateMachine()
494                                        .performStateUpdate(nextState, m.getCurrentState(), sampler);
495
496                        // update nextState... pre-agent processing
497                        this.outbreakProcessors.forEach(p -> {
498                                if (p.getSelector().test(m)) {
499                                        p.getConsumer().accept(nextState, m, sampler);
500                                }
501                        });
502
503                        // agent processing
504                        m.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(p -> this.updateState(p));
505
506                }
507        }
508
509        /**
510         * Creates the next state factory, as a copy of current state and applies a
511         * chain of PersonUpdaters to the next state factory. The PersonUpdaters can
512         * change the next state by modifying the state factory
513         *
514         * @param person the mutable holder for the immutable person state.
515         */
516        private void updateState(Person person) {
517                // This is a thread local instance of sampler. so there should be one
518                // per thread. We shouldn't reset the seed though.
519                var sampler = Sampler.getSampler();
520                var nextState = person.getNextState().toOptional().get();
521                if (person instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
522                        var m = (ModifiablePerson) person;
523
524                        // Update the state machine (for the behaviour).
525                        m.getStateMachine().performStateUpdate(
526                                        nextState, person.getCurrentState(), sampler
527                        );
528
529                        // What is the correct order here?
530                        // It feels like this should be done before the state update above for
531                        // each person but realistically it doesn't matter as the updates are
532                        // unaware of each others effects. The only thing that would have
533                        // changed is the individual's behaviour e.g. m.getStateMachine().
534
535                        nextState
536                                        // Update the viral load model and the risk models.
537                                        // These requires an up to date history for the exposures.
538                                        .setInHostModel(
539                                                        m.getCurrentState().getInHostModel()
540                                                                        .update(person, sampler)
541                                        ).setRiskModel(m.getCurrentState().getRiskModel().update());
542
543                        // update nextState...
544                        this.personProcessors.forEach(p -> {
545                                if (p.getSelector().test(m)) {
546                                        p.getConsumer().accept(nextState, m, sampler);
547                                }
548                        });
549
550                }
551        }
552
553        /**
554         * This method allows you to add a outbreak processor to the update cycle.
555         * Outbreak processors are the final step to be run in updating an outbreak
556         * immediately before the agents in the outbreak are updated. When they
557         * operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current
558         * state will also refer to time (t). However the policy state machine state
559         * will reflect time (t+1).
560         *
561         * @see Updater#withOutbreakProcessors(OutbreakStateUpdater...)
562         * @param test    A predicate that test whether the outbreak should be
563         *                updated. This could for example be a time based filter.
564         * @param updater An 3 parameter function referring to a outbreak state, the
565         *                current state, and a RNG sampler. An example here could
566         *                change the transmissibility of the outbreak at a set time.
567         * @return The updater ( a fluent method)
568         */
569        public Updater withOutbreakProcessor(
570                        Predicate<Outbreak> test,
571                        TriConsumer<ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, Outbreak, Sampler> updater
572        ) {
573                this.outbreakProcessors
574                                .add(ModelOperation.updateOutbreakState(test, updater));
575                return this;
576        }
577
578        /**
579         * Outbreak processors are the final step to be run in updating an outbreak
580         * immediately before the agents in the outbreak are updated. When they
581         * operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current
582         * state will also refer to time (t). However the policy state machine state
583         * will reflect time (t+1).
584         *
585         * @param updaters see
586         *                 {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation#updateOutbreakState(Predicate, TriConsumer)}
587         * @return the updater as a fluent method
588         */
589        public Updater withOutbreakProcessors(OutbreakStateUpdater... updaters) {
590                this.outbreakProcessors.addAll(Arrays.asList(updaters));
591                return this;
592        }
593
594        /**
595         * This method allows you to add a person processor to the update cycle.
596         * Person processors are the final step to be run in updating an person
597         * immediately before the final update. When they operate the head of the
598         * history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to
599         * time (t). The in host model and risk model will have been updated to (t+1)
600         * but this will not yet have been applied to the current state. However the
601         * behaviour state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
602         *
603         * @see Updater#withPersonProcessors(PersonStateUpdater...)
604         * @param test    A predicate that test whether the person should be updated
605         * @param updater An 3 parameter function referring to a person state, the
606         *                current state, and a RNG sampler.
607         * @return The updater ( a fluent method)
608         */
609        public Updater withPersonProcessor(
610                        Predicate<Person> test,
611                        TriConsumer<ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler> updater
612        ) {
613                this.personProcessors
614                                .add(ModelOperation.updatePersonState(test, updater));
615                return this;
616        }
617
618        /**
619         * Person processors are the final step to be run in updating an person
620         * immediately before the final update. When they operate the head of the
621         * history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to
622         * time (t). The in host model and risk model will have been updated to (t+1)
623         * but this will not yet have been applied to the current state. However the
624         * behaviour state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
625         *
626         * @param updaters see
627         *                 {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation#updatePersonState(Predicate, TriConsumer)}
628         * @return the updater as a fluent method
629         */
630        public Updater withPersonProcessors(PersonStateUpdater... updaters) {
631                this.personProcessors.addAll(Arrays.asList(updaters));
632                return this;
633        }
634}
